definition: to talk/to get into conversation with/to send word
to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: I caught sight of her hurrying away but i didn't try to speak to her.
sentences.chinese: 我見她匆忙走過，但我並未想與她搭話。

sentences.english: If an owl speak to thee, make it no answer.
sentences.chinese: 若有隻貓頭鷹跟你搭話，只充耳不聞。

sentences.english: She is too shy to dare accost him.
sentences.chinese: 她太害羞了，不敢和他搭話。

sentences.english: After a little while he spake to me, and asked me my desire.
sentences.chinese: 過了一會兒，他向我搭話，詢問我的念想。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, her mother had accosted the physician.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，她母親已和那醫生搭話了。

sentences.english: Joey and Chandler are egging him on to go talk to her.
sentences.chinese: 僑依和錢德勒在慫恿他去和她搭話。

sentences.english: He ruminated on his defences before he should accost her father.
sentences.chinese: 他在與她父親搭話前，仔細地考慮著他的防範措施。

sentences.english: Naturally, a man came over to her and asked her if she wanted a drink.
sentences.chinese: 很自然，有個男人上來搭話，問她要不要喝一杯。
